name: Docker
description: Build a Docker image, push an image to a registry, run an image in a container or run any docker command.
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: dockerServiceEndpoint
inputs.label: Docker Host Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the connection to the Docker container host.

inputs.name: dockerRegistryServiceEndpoint
inputs.label: Docker Registry Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the connection to the Docker Registry.

inputs.name: dockerFile
inputs.label: Docker File
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Path to Dockerfile to use with the Docker Build action. Wild cards can be used. For example **/Dockerfile. 
Note: The path must be to a file within the Docker build context.

inputs.name: imageName
inputs.label: Image Name
inputs.visibleRule: action = Build an image || action = Push an image || action = Run an image
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Name of the image to use during build, run or push actions. Image name should be in lowercase only. 
Usually in the format 'your-username/image-name:tag' sans quotes for example, fabrikam/webapp:latest. When working with the Docker registry you need to specify 'username'.

inputs.name: context
inputs.label: Context
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the folder to build from. Docker builds images from a Dockerfile and a 'context'.

inputs.name: containerName
inputs.label: Container Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Container name to use to run an image.

inputs.name: ports
inputs.label: Ports
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Port mappings to pass to the run commnad in hostmachine-port:container-port format. 
 For example, -p 80:8080 binds port 8080 of the container to port 80 of the host machine. 
 Specify each port mapping in a new line.

Port mappings to pass to the run commnad in hostmachine-port:container-port format. 
For example, -p 80:8080 binds port 8080 of the container to port 80 of the host machine. 
Specify each port mapping in a new line.

inputs.name: envVars
inputs.label: Environment Variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name value pairs to set as environment variables in the container. Specify each name=value pair in a new line
Name value pairs to set as environment variables in the container. Specify each name=value pair in a new line.

inputs.name: removeImageAfterPublish
inputs.label: Remove image after publish
inputs.visibleRule: action = Publish image && action = always hide for now because of async publish
inputs.helpMarkDown: When set the image is force removed after publishing.

inputs.name: customCommand
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: Docker command with arguments to execute. For example, 'rmi -f image-name' sans quotes to force remove an image
Docker command with arguments to execute. For example, 'rmi -f image-name' sans quotes to force remove an image.

inputs.name: additionalArgs
inputs.label: Command for container
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify a command and its arguments, if any, for the container to run.
 For example, if the image contains a simple Python Flask web application you can specify 'python app.py' to launch the web application.

Specify a command and its arguments, if any, for the container to run.
For example, if the image contains a simple Python Flask web application you can specify 'python app.py' to launch the web application.

inputs.name: cwd
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Current working directory where the certificates will be created.
